Key Arguments: The bill restricts freedom of speech and thought, moving Australia towards a tyrannical government.
Definitions of harm in the bill are overly broad and subjective, allowing government overreach.
The bill allows the government to determine acceptable facts, opinions, and beliefs, which is a form of thought control.
The bill's harm definitions could suppress scientific inquiry and debate.
Exclusions for government institutions and corporations undermine equality under the law.
Notable Quotes: Withdraw this Bill so we the Australian people can retain our democratic rights.
The Bill moves Australia towards the goal of restricting opposing views.
This Bill gives the Government powers to determine what are acceptable prevailing facts, opinions and beliefs, which is thought control of the people and must be rejected.
The intent of this section is to relieve the Government and its employees and associates of its obligation to be truthful.
